fields.value: X-ray CT of Egyptian Votive Box EA49146

dsDescriptionValue.value: X-ray computed tomography data for a copper alloy Egyptian votive box (British Museum EA49146), thought to contain animal remains. Description: Hollow-cast, copper alloy votive box, also known as relic-box or animal coffin; rectangular case surmounted by a solid-cast figure of a lizard with head slightly raised; two eyelets for suspension on opposite corners of top of the case; though the back end still closed with square metal plaque, residue of linen visible; case complete and sealed, should contains a mummified lizard (or parts of). Although the box material has a negative impact on the image quality, apparent animal remains can be seen inside the box. "EA49146 - CT Slices.zip" contains tomographic slices of the box (TIFF format), side view. "EA49146_10fps.avi" is a video of the slices in the zip file above

publicationCitation.value:
Masson-Berghoff, A. and O’Flynn, D. (2019), Absent, invisible or revealed ‘relics’? X-radiography and CT scanning of Egyptian bronze votive boxes from Naukratis and elsewhere, British Museum Studies in Ancient Egypt and Sudan 25 (2019)

https://www.britishmuseum.org/pdf/BMSAES/Issue%2024/Masson-Berghoff_O'Flynn_24.pdf
